‚ÄúOver the past week and a half, as the Israeli-Hamas war has unfolded, I have watched in horror as my fears about hate speech and violence have begun to come true,‚Äù Anika Collier Navaroli writes in The Emancipator. In 2022, she blew the whistle about her warnings to Twitter that went unheeded leading to the January 6th attack on the Capitol and the platform‚Äôs ultimate decision to suspend former President Donald Trump. 

As the FBI warned of violent threats,  a six-year-old was targeted in a hate crime and stabbed 26 times by his landlord near Chicago for being Palestinian. Without serious enforcement of anti-hate speech policies on social media, this danger might only grow ‚Äî it has before.

In the 1900s, the first blockbuster movie, Birth of a Nation, romanticized racism and glorified racial violence. After the film was shown across the country, the KKK‚Äôs numbers only swelled, allowing the organization to spread beyond its Southern base, and setting the stage for the deaths of thousands of Black Americans.

In Rwanda, the private radio station Radio T√©l√©vision Libre des Mille Collines (RTLM) was created in the early 1990s to incite violence against the Tutsi ethnic minority. It aired programs that called Tutsis ‚Äúcockroaches‚Äô' and ‚Äúsnakes,‚Äù and asked the Hutus, Rwanda‚Äôs ethnic and political majority, to ‚Äúexterminate‚Äù and ‚Äúcut down‚Äù the Tutsi people.  Almost a million Tutsis died during the conflict, and in 2003, an international court convicted three RTLM executives of genocide for their role in inciting violence through hate speech on the radio.

Most recently in 2022, Amnesty International research showed how hate speech on social media substantially contributed to the genocide of the predominantly Muslim Rohingya ethnic minority in Myanmar. Although hate speech was already prohibited by Facebook and Twitter, social media feeds in the country were flooded with posts calling the Rohingya ‚Äúinvaders‚Äù and ‚Äúdogs‚Äù that needed ‚Äúto be shot.‚Äù Nearly 10,000 Rohingya were killed and almost one million were forced to flee the country.

Read Navaroli‚Äôs full piece at the link in bio.

Sending love and support to all effected.

Over the last few weeks, tens of thousands of people have fled to Armenia through the Lachin Corridor, most of whom are women, children and the elderly. The region has endured years of conflict in which people have lost their homes and livelihoods.

The humanitarian needs for those impacted are immense. @icrc, @ifrc, and @armenianredcross are all working to provide vital assistance, with the top priority being to support both people leaving and those who choose to stay.

@canadadev has generously provided funds to ICRC to support their lifesaving work across the Lachin Corridor and to IFRC to support people who have recently arrived in Armenia.

The Canadian Red Cross has also contributed funds to both ICRC and IFRC from our International Disaster Relief Fund (IDRF) to support the Red Cross and Red Crescent response. During crises like this, we reply on the flexible funding provided by our donors through the IDRF. This type of funding allows us to support people and communities impacted by emergencies by rapidly sending funding, relief items and humanitarian experts to support. 

Donate now at redcross.ca

U.S. President Joe Biden will postpone his visit to Jordan and a planned meeting with King Abdullah II of Jordan and President Abbas of the Palestinian Authority and President Sisi of Egypt, the White House confirmed on Oct. 17.

The President was scheduled to travel to Jordan following a scheduled visit to Israel on Oct. 18.

"After consulting with King Abdullah II of Jordan and in light of the days of mourning announced by President Abbas of the Palestinian Authority, President Biden will postpone his travel to Jordan and the planned meeting with these two leaders and President Sisi of Egypt," the White House stated in a statement.

According to a senior White House official, the decision to cancel the meeting was "mutual."

Earlier today, hundreds of people were been confirmed dead in a strike on a Gaza City hospital. Hamas blamed an Israeli air strike, while Israel claims the hospital was hit by a rocket misfired by a radical Palestinian militant group.

"Immediately upon hearing this news [of the strike], I spoke with King Abdullah II of Jordan, and Prime Minister Netanyahu of Israel and have directed my national security team to continue gathering information about what exactly happened," President Biden stated on X.

"The United States stands unequivocally for the protection of civilian life during conflict and we mourn the patients, medical staff and other innocents killed or wounded in this tragedy."

A Jordanian official reportedly told journalists from NBC News that all parties agreed to the cancellation. The official stated that the summit would not be able to achieve any goals under the current circumstances.

Photo: Getty Images

President Joe Biden departed via Air Force One at Tuesday evening for his trip to Israel.
The president is expected to arrive today and meet with Israeli leaders about the ongoing conflict.

A planned meeting in Jordan with King Abdullah II, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi and Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas has been canceled, according to a U.S. official, who added it was a "mutual decision."

"The president sent his deepest condolences for the innocent lives lost in the hospital explosion in Gaza, and wished a speedy recovery to the wounded. He looks forward to consulting in person with these leaders soon, and agreed to remain regularly and directly engaged with each of them over the coming days," a White House official said.

I'm sure many of you have been burdened by the conflict in the Middle East as well as for the nation of Israel as we have. 

Since 2018, the Lord has knitted our hearts with Israel through key scriptural revelations from Isaiah 42, Romans 11, Isaiah 24. This gave us direction as a worship & missions ministry in raising up the Song of the Lord from the gentile nations to bring a Romans 11 provocation for Israel‚Äôs salvation. 

We had been planning the Isaiah 24 Project Israel experience with One King Ministries, to bring 100 worship singers and musicians from the nations to Israel. In light of the war, we have decided to postpone the trip to 2024. 

But the songwriting aspect of Isaiah 24 Project begins now. 

In Isaiah 24, the prophet predicted a day when the east and west would sing of the glory of God to Israel and the nations in a time of extreme crisis. We are now in a time of extreme crisis for Israel and the region. 

What is happening in Israel is a spiritual battle. His worshippers must release the song of the Lord in this hour. It is in worship that powers of darkness are defeated - just like how King Jehoshaphat‚Äôs battle was won through praise and worship! 

As a first step we are launching a Youtube channel to distribute music that is written with the heart and burden of Isaiah24. 

You can find the channel at: www.youtube.com/@Isaiah24Project 

Please also follow @isaiah24project 

#isa24 #isaiah24project

(Toronto, ON) October 18, 2023 ‚Äì The Muslim Advisory Council of Canada (MACC) is deeply concerned about the sudden rise in Islamophobic incidents in various sectors across Canada, including healthcare. Over the past couple of weeks, several Islamophobic incidents have been directly reported to the Muslim Advisory Council of Canada by physicians, physicians‚Äô assistants, and patients seeking medical assistance in Canadian healthcare facilities. This, of course, is linked to the devastating events that have taken place, and continue to take place, in Israel and Palestine. Our heartfelt condolences are with both Israelis and Palestinians who have suffered unimaginable losses.

Unfortunately, yesterday, we learned of an attack on Al-Ahli Arab Hospital in Gaza, resulting in the death of hundreds of civilians. In accordance with international law, hospitals and critical civilian infrastructure should not be targeted. Hospitals must be a safe haven for the injured. The
growing number of innocent civilians who have lost their lives in this conflict, including women and children, is an atrocity. As stated by Prime Minister Trudeau yesterday, "International humanitarian and international law needs to be respected in this and in all cases. There are rules around wars and it's not acceptable to hit a hospital." The United Nations and the World Health Organization strongly condemned the act, with the WHO calling for the immediate protection of civilians and healthcare.

New Democrats are horrified and heartbroken by the violence in Israel and Palestine. We grieve with so many Canadians affected.‚Ä®‚Ä®We strongly condemn the terrorist attacks Hamas on thousands of innocent Israeli civilians. We call for the immediate safe return of all hostages and have asked Canada to do far more to protect Canadians seeking to leave the region.‚Ä®‚Ä®Palestinians are suffering at a scale we have never seen as a result of the siege of Gaza. Thousands of innocent Palestinians have been killed. Some of these victims of bombardments have families and friends in Canada who are mourning their loss. More than a million people have been displaced with no safe place to go.¬†‚Ä®‚Ä®Canada must advocate for an immediate ceasefire, the release of all hostages, an end to the siege of Gaza, unimpeded and immediate humanitarian access and a full respect for international law. Anything less would be a betrayal of our values.¬†‚Ä®‚Ä®We are deeply concerned by the alarming increase in anti-Semitism, anti-Palestinian racism and Islamophobia. In the past week alone, we have witnessed appalling hate-motivated attacks in communities across Canada. All Canadians should feel safe in their communities. In these dark times, we must treat each other with compassion and empathy and recognize our common humanity.¬†‚Ä®‚Ä®A decades-long cycle of violence and occupation has already taken the lives of too many Palestinians and Israelis.¬† There is no military solution to this conflict. That is why it is more important than ever that we urge the Government of Canada to call for an immediate ceasefire and work towards a just peace.¬†‚Ä®‚Ä®Canada can and must do better. New Democrats stand in solidarity with all those seeking peace and justice in Israel and Palestine.

The Celebrity Cricket League (CCL) was due to end yesterday, but it appears that celebrity feuds have once again caused havoc on the field, as the match was postponed for the second time. 

No fighting or scuffle took place at the game. However, the organisers had to temporarily halt the game again, due to a quarrel between two actors. 

This time, the conflict is about two actors named Rabbi and Antu. The two have played in the corporate league before. So according to the rules they cannot play in the celebrity cricket league. Among them, Rabbi belongs to Salahuddin Lavlu's team while Antu is playing for Dipankar Dipon's team.

üö® Old ways of spotting fake news and misinformation don't work anymore.

‚úîÔ∏è Sure, the basics matter: Does the website look professional? Does it make sense? Do a lot of people seem to believe it?

‚ùå But even if it ticks these boxes, it might still be false.

üòÖ Teaching simple tricks like these can lead to false confidence. 100,000 likes? A slick website? A .org domain? No spelling errors? It seems legit, but looks can be deceiving.

üíª Check out our newest blog post for suggestions on how to teach your kids a better way to spot false information. Link in bio.

The world is at a pivotal moment and it was the need to hear stories of the power of the human spirit that got us to the media announcement of @sachislifemovie. We weren't disappointed! The film draws inspiration from an extraordinary true story about a mother and her 3-year-old boy diagnosed with muscular dystrophy, and the push for survival that the entire family faces over the next 30 years, and will be starring @iamkirtikulhari (4 More Shots, Please!, Pink, Criminal Justice) and @jimsarbhforreal (Rocket Boys, Made in Heaven, Padmaavat), and is produced by NJ-based @redbisonproductions and written/directed by @thescientistfilmmaker. 

A story of resilience, hope, and determination, the film is based on the real-life Munshi family whose son, Sachin, was diagnosed with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy. The lengths parents will go to save their children and give them their best life was so powerful, especially now, and we look forward to seeing it come alive on screen with this inspiring Kashmiri family's story at the center of the immensely talented cast and crew's portrayal.

*As we continue to watch the ongoing conflict, please stay tuned to our stories, where we will post resources to help Palestinian families. We continue to hope this loss of human life on both sides will cease.*

#sachislife #sachislifemovie @neerja.pr #desi #southasian #southasianmovies #duchenne #duchennemusculardystrophy

The world was so quick to accuse Israel of bombing a hospital - including @nytimes - as evidenced by their changing headlines that you can see here ‚¨ÖÔ∏è‚¨ÖÔ∏è‚¨ÖÔ∏è. Taking the word of Hamas without properly investigating the source of the explosion at the hospital matters because when The NY Times and other outlets jump to conclusions, it leads to new riots across the Middle  East. And even though the @idf has presented evidence that the explosion was due to a misfire of a rocket from Gaza by Palestinian Islamic Jihad, the assumption on the street, even with evidence, is that Israel was behind it. Bad journalism, lack of due diligence and words can make this conflict spread further out of control. We mourn the loss of life and just like the massacre in Israel and the deaths of those sheltering in the hospital, and future casualties of Gaza civilians being used as human shields, responsibility lies squarely with the terrorist organizations of Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad. This is why peace has been out of reach for so long. Despite 5+ attempts at a land for peace deal, Israel has had no reliable partner.

Couldn‚Äôt live comfortably in these recent days, but today‚Äôs news was too much to not spread the news, speak up, and create a post to sum up this common feeling. üáµüá∏ü§≤üèª

You definitely know what's happening right now in our temporary world. If you didn‚Äôt know before, somehow you started realizing that there are things that used to be covered up, distorted, and claimed as an excuse to do injustice.

For a long time ago, there‚Äôs neither war nor conflict in the Land of Olives (symbolized by green color in their flag). Instead, a colonialism, genocide, ethnic cleansing, massacre ‚Ä¶ you name it. Unfortunately, the world was blinded by major medias which tend to be in the money-and-power-source side. I hope the current situation can reveal the reality one by one. 

Not gonna talk about the resistance or condemnation (u know which is which!) bcs it‚Äôs been overwhelming. However, right in the night before Gaza Hospital blast, I had a conversation with an Indonesian friend living in Japan.

üí•N: I‚Äôm trying to target that video (slide 8) for my friends who are still neutral, even I know some Japaneses defending ISRL.
üí• ME: No wonder. Their media dragged the issues into H4M45.
üí• N: Honestly, I‚Äôm overwhelmed. Been logged out IG many times bcs I‚Äôm not strong enough. So sad, so annoyed.
üí• ME: Sometimes I think that the departed souls are lucky. The world has become very cruel‚Ä¶but I‚Äôm not ready to depart yet.
üí• N: RELATEEEE üò≠üò≠üò≠

See? That‚Äôs how it is when the mothers think too much about something. Overthinking is our middle name. We worry about our child's development, their achievement, their social life‚Ä¶ every day! Meanwhile, in PLSTN, a mother is just worried about how long she can continue to hold her child alive until she herself dies. There‚Äôs nothing more heartbreaking than this continuing strikes. üíîüíîüíî 

Update on 19 Oct: They bombed church used for family shelter too üò§üò°

#speaklouder #stopgenocide by #settlercolonyofIsrael

There were plans in place for today and then Joe Biden came to town. That may give the impression that I was urgently reassigned to document the visiting POTUS as he held emergency meetings in secret war rooms but that would very much not be the case. What it did mean was that Tel Aviv ground to a standstill. The story I hoped to cover in the south had to be cancelled and the funeral I was aiming to attend was missed. Every avenue both creatively and literally was a roadblock.

With the world looking towards Israel to find out what would happen next following the horrific scenes from the hospital in Gaza, the families of the hostages taken by Hamas took to the streets outside the central military base to make their voices heard. Sticking posters to passing cars and tying yellow ribbons to all of the trees and pillars along the road, these friends and family members must be in such unbelievable turmoil as they think of what may now come. 

Among the photos and posters on display, one woman‚Äôs handwritten sign stood out in its message; ‚ÄúBring them home. No revenge.‚Äù
.
.
.
#israel #war #conflict #hostages #joebiden #biden #potus #gettyimages

Maybe in the end, we've all been doing all that we can. 

Maybe things have been going they way the need to, and maybe we need to realize that Rome wasn't built in a day, and that it won't be deconstructed in one either. 

Maybe we need to really support those who need help the most, in whatever ways each individual has the capacity to do, and not shun or try to outperform one another.

Maybe we begin to look at the human, the humanity, of each and every individual and cast everything else aside.

Maybe we will recognize the other, the symbolic order, hyper reality, and maybe we can live and let live, for now (or at least support people when inevitable conflict arises). 

Maybe great change will come from multiplicities of rhizomatic individuals deciding to change themselves before they try to change the whole world. 

Just Maybe. 

#anarchy

As violence escalates in the Middle East, we have seen a troubling rise in Islamophobic and anti-Semitic rhetoric and acts in the United States. LIRS unequivocally condemns hate in all forms and stands for the human dignity of all people, no matter where they were born or where they now call home. 

We pray for peace and an end to violence in Israel, Gaza, and the West Bank and advocate for a world where all can practice their faith without fear. The loss of life and dehumanization of those impacted by the conflict are anathema to our principles of welcome and hope for those seeking safety. 

We call on the United States government to advocate for an immediate ceasefire in the region and do everything within its power to mitigate the suffering of Israelis, Palestinians, and all affected by the war.

We are collectively witnessing genocide happen in real time. 

Yesterday Israeli government bombed a hospital. The Israeli government has been trying to conceal the wrong doing by spreading misinformation when they warned the physicians and nurses to evacuate 5 days prior to the bombing, then their own Israeli Digital Spokesperson tweeted the successful bombing then deleted his tweet after. This victim blaming/ gaslighting is another level of hate and they need to be held accountable for this catastrophe. Locals say aside from the medical workers and patients, innocent civilians have been taking shelter at the hospital because they have no where else to go and thought would be the safest. So it‚Äôs actually more than 500 people murdered. This is extremely atrocious and demonic. This isn‚Äôt even the first hospital they bombed. My heart has been breaking over and over again. 

‚ÄúDid you know that even wars have rules? The rules of war, also called International Humanitarian Law. IHL protects people who are not fighting like civilians and wounded or captured fighters. It ensures humane treatment and humanitarian assistance. IHL also restricts the weapons and tactics that fighters can use which helps to protect civilians and civilian objects like homes, schools, hospitals. Civilians are #notatarget.‚Äù ‚ÄúCivilians must be protected at all times. IHL must be respected and upheld‚Äù. - @unitednations Attacking civilians is a violation against IHL and a war crime. 

For those who still don‚Äôt know the full 75 year history of the conflict, you don‚Äôt need a PhD in this subject matter at this point. This collective punishment of 2.2 million civilians of Gaza for Hamas‚Äô act is wrong. This is the dire time now where your humanity, your moral compass should really speak for where you stand. Everyone MUST demand immediate ceasefire now. This must be stopped. 

Note: Commenting has been turned off to stop the spread of misinformation and gaslighting comments that defends this genocide. The confusion of how you want to keep defending the Israeli government‚Äôs ruthless actions that breaches on humanity makes me feel sick to my stomach.

#gazagenocide #gaza#palestine#israel#zionist #war

Living Christ, you say you are always with those who suffer, with those who are crushed and terrified, with all who are drowned by sorrow and rage. And since I take you at your word, this means that you walk this very moment in Israel and Gaza, among the millions who are tear-stained and grief-stricken. You walk among the corpses in desolate kibbutzes and cratered City streets. You bend your ear toward the thunderous wails of lament. 

Suffering Christ, you once shed tears on this same soil. You wept. Surely you weep again. As you make your way among the shattered children who now have no parent to sing away the fear -- sing a song over them. As you walk these rubbled neighborhoods, remind us that in our terror and in our retribution, we kill our brothers and our sisters. 

Risen Christ, your resurrection story seems ludicrous, naive, especially when war burns hot. How do we live your resurrection amid a conflict so ancient and entrenched, so extreme in its inhumanity, so lopsided in its disbursement of power? Teach us to seek justice in just ways. Teach us that ‚Äúthey‚Äù ‚Äî all of us ‚Äî are your beloved. 

Living Christ, you teach us to pray, ‚Äúon earth as in heaven.‚Äù You teach us to live ‚Äúon earth as in heaven.‚Äù This death and destruction, we know, is not heaven. None of it. Give us life. Stop our killing. Protect the innocent. Give us justice. Give us mercy. 

Merciful Christ, save us from ourselves.

Before Love Gets Serious: 3 Essential Questions to Ask‚Å†
‚Å†
Love is a beautiful journey, but before you take those serious steps, it's crucial to ensure you're both on the same page.‚Å†
‚Å†
In our latest article (link in bio), we explore three fundamental questions to ask before diving into a committed relationship.‚Å†
‚Å†
1. What Are Our Long-Term Goals? Love flourishes when you share similar visions for the future. It's essential to discuss your long-term goals, dreams, and aspirations. Do they align with yours? This alignment can be the cornerstone of a strong and enduring relationship.‚Å†
‚Å†
2. Are We Compatible in Values and Beliefs? Shared values and beliefs are the glue that holds a relationship together. Talk openly about your faith, morals, and principles. Do they harmonize with your partner's? This compatibility can help navigate challenges and celebrate shared values.‚Å†
‚Å†
3. How Do We Handle Conflict? Conflict is a natural part of any relationship. It's essential to understand how both of you approach and resolve conflicts. Healthy communication and conflict resolution strategies are essential for a thriving partnership.‚Å†
‚Å†
Remember, love grows when nurtured with open communication and mutual understanding.‚Å†
‚Å†
These questions aren't meant to create doubt but to strengthen your connection and ensure you're building a relationship that aligns with your vision and values.‚Å†
‚Å†
Dive into the full article (link in bio) for a deeper exploration of these questions and insights.‚Å†
‚Å†
P.S. Share your thoughts and experiences in the comments!

The escalating conflict in Gaza, Palestine, has intensified the critical demand for medical supplies. Prior to the devastating strike on Al-Ahli Baptist Hospital, an incident marked as not only the deadliest bombing in Gaza's history but possibly in Palestinian history, the region's medical infrastructure had sustained irreparable damage. Healthcare providers are operating under dire circumstances, grappling with restricted access to medical resources and an environment that hinders their ability to deliver timely and high-quality healthcare.

On 17 October 2023, MERCY Malaysia Palestinian Staff and volunteers in Gaza, Palestine distributed essential medicines to the Ministry of Health (MOH) as part of our ongoing efforts to address the pressing medical needs in the region.

MERCY Malaysia is monitoring the humanitarian needs and impact and looking at all possibilities to provide aid to support those in need of humanitarian assistance.

Jordan is doing all it can to stop the conflict but will not become complicit in another expulsion of Palestinians from their homes, Jordanian Foreign Minister Ayman Safadi said on Wednesday.

The Hashemite kingdom will treat any attempt to displace the Palestinians as ‚Äúa declaration of war,‚Äù Safadi vowed, as quoted by the outlet Roya News.

Amman will not allow ‚Äúa new catastrophe‚Äù nor will it let Israel ‚Äúshift the crisis created and exacerbated by the occupation to neighboring countries,‚Äù he added.
